content: Cardano's method, also known as Ferrari's method, is a method for solving cubic equations of the form ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d = 0. The method was developed by the Italian mathematician Girolamo Cardano in the 16th century and was later improved upon by Ludovico Ferrari. The method involves first transforming the equation into a standard form, and then using a series of algebraic operations to find the roots of the equation. The method can be used to find the roots of any cubic equation, but it is particularly well-suited for equations that do not have rational roots.
